author: Special Correspondent
text:
Women police personnel serving in the Government Railway Police, Tiruchi District, were put through a day-long session on managing stress, personality development, and leadership skills with the avowed objective to serve public better.

The programme was organised on the International Women’s Day on the sprawling Railway Protection Force Training Centre in Khajamalai by engaging resource persons on different subjects.

Around 150 women police officers and constables serving in different railway police stations from Villupuram to Nagercoil, falling within GRP, Tiruchi District limits, took part in the programme.

Tips

The event began at the crack of dawn with yoga class for the participants to improve their personality and relax their mind. This was followed by separate sessions on managing stress, developing leadership skills, ways to manage work-life balance, communication, and soft skills. Tips were given to keep their mind and body absolutely fit and food intake to maintain good physical health.

The participants were put through music therapy for relaxation of mind.

Z. Annie Vijaya, Superintendent of Police, GRP, Tiruchi, said the programme was organised with the objective of helping women police personnel manage stress and strike a balance between work and their personal life.

The mosaic of sessions were organised to help women police personnel understand their strength and weakness and handle challenging situation with confidence, the Superintendent of Police said.
title: Women police personnel learn stress management
